title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Odd interview process. The hiring team did not set up an initial screening call, they just invited me in for an in-person interview right away. In hindsight, I regret not asking to hear more about the position before going in for the interview. A bit of an awkward process as the people interviewing me took turns reading questions off a sheet. They jumped right into asking very specific questions before asking more broad questions about my background. Overall an awkward process.
Interview Questions: Give an example where you showed leadership and initiative.

title: QA Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview took 1, 5 hours. 30 min for test automation task, 1 hour for an interview. 5 interviewers, they ask mostly technical questions. Many theoretical questions. Very polite and professional. Overall have a good impression.

title: Software QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: skills test: about login page both test case and automation design, it took 1h then in person interview: one manager, one Dev, one QA leader, it took 30 minutes, many are basic testing knowledge
Interview Questions: testing knowledge, automation skills previous experience

title: Junior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: very good. they ask you to go and seat and bring water and then they start asking questions like how are you what is your name blah blah. then they will continue with their interview until you are done
Interview Questions: what is your availability if we hire you?

title: Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: 5 people attended the interview. Only one of them was friendly. Others were suspicious and focused to make the interviewee uncomfortable. Total of 11 questions were asked. one of them was technical, others were behavioral.
Interview Questions: What would be your reaction if a student does not listen to you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was in person and it didnt have any stress for me. That was friendly and good. I try to be more confident and describle how my experience can help the company
Interview Questions: Say some example that shows your experience help this position

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
Telephonic recruiter resume review and screening call,
Take home assignment related to PM activity,
Strategy presentation on part of the role,
Panel Interview (6 people) leading to round of executive interview and reference checks
Interview Questions: Interview circled around PM setting up program, roadmap, reporting, change management etc.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Screening call with HR was off putting, with repeated questions about salary and relocation details during a single conversation. Disappointed that there wasn’t more transparency about salary ranges for non-union positions.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the role?

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Questions were not reliable or measurable. Borderline unethical at times. Questions could not be asked of both internal and external candidates. Questions and flow were clearly related to past conversations and experiences

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 7 members on zoom . Asked question to be answered using Star schema including examples for each.  I never heard back. So I didn’t get hired. Questions were behavioral and technical in nature.
Interview Questions: Technical questions about the technologies they use

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: You need to prepare a min 10 mins lesson, then the panel will ask you questions related to the presentation. Also, they will ask you questions related to your management of the classroom and flipped education.
Interview Questions: describe how you handle a situation with a student who is causing issues.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: They have a recruitment agency does their first and second screening.  The interview was pretty straightforward. Recruiters were polite in general.  So no matter you apply through BCIT directly or not, the agency will be contact you if they are interested.
Interview Questions: Many questions about your previous job and experiences

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: well, I didn't get interviewed as much as I just applied for the program I was interested in and got accepted. Looking back it was the right decision to make.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burns Lake, BC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process in school of business has to be the most stressful and not very transparent. You are never told before about the number of people that will interview you. There can be 6 to 8 people and you are never communicated!!!!! Further, these are all full time faculty members and they have a clear bias towards their own staff who are interviewing for the same position as part time staff If you don't know full time faculty, don't bother. You will not be hired. Very opaque way of doing things. DISGUSTING.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your 5 years plan ..... redundant!!

title: Help Desk Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Round table process with 6 or so current employees, as well as the helpdesk manager. Will ask a bunch of personal questions that are generally quite easy as long as you're honest, and a few simple technical questions.
Interview Questions: Showed an artifact and asked what it was.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: they asked  me to give an introduction about myself. then they asked questions about my experiences and and skills. some questions about my strengths and gave  me time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: describe one problem that you were facing with and could solve it.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Application process is online; there are testing requirements; multiple interviews are a possibility
Interview Questions: How do you resolve workplace conflicts.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at British Columbia Institute of Technology (Burnaby, BC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
*On line applications and resumes only are accepted by BCIT 
*Only those selected for a interview are contacted
*A small panel of 5 meet with candidate
*The interview consists of primarility information gathering and behaviour based questions
* Only the potential candidate will be contacted by phone with the request for references and the possibility of a second interview.
(Advice: research the School, Department and any outside agencies associated with the position)
Interview Questions: Specific details about the processes involved with the position.
